newsitem.title: CHILE: Quinenco says stock regulators approved IPO.
newsitem.headline: Quinenco says stock regulators approved IPO.

text.p: Holding company Quinenco SA said Chilean stock regulators have already approved the inscription of its shares, effectively allowing its Initial Public Offering to go ahead despite a suspension announced by stock regulators.
"The inscription (of the shares) was approved on Thursday, June 12, so the process will continue on its normal course," said the company's general manager Fernando Silva.
Officials at the Stocks and Securities Superintendency were not available for comment.

The superintendency said Friday it had ordered Quinenco, holding company for the Luksic group's interests, to suspend its IPO after it published a newspaper ad announcing the IPO before the inscription had been approved and the shares placed.
But Silva said the superintendency approved the inscription on Thursday -- one day after the newspaper ad was published.
